job_history.work_description: Attend professional development, communications with parents, assessments of students, and staff meetings. Teach high level Talent Development Students English 1 level course work. Lead 8th grade ELA Professional Learning Community. Establish and maintain positive relationships with students, parents, and colleagues. Teach students that are academically struggling and in need of a small classroom setting for successful development.

Provided students with an academically enriched opportunity that addresses core skills for mastery level performance. Helped bridge the academic gap documented by school assessments. Enhanced student skill and overall academic success at Ridge Road.

Create an outlet and social transitional aid for Ridge Road's 8th Grade ladies, heading to high school. Cover common issues that the young ladies face daily such as; health, fitness, daily troubles, social media, self advocacy, public speaking, and studies. Award participants with awards, scholarships, and gifts from the community sponsors.

Facilitate the involvement of the school community in the development of the School Improvement Plan. Encourage, support and create opportunities for involvement from parents in the community. Contribute to the design of the School Improvement Plan. Monitor the effectiveness of the School Improvement Plan. Use data as the driving force to create programmatic instructional change. Facilitate communication within the Professional Learning Community.

Coordinate the improvement of instruction of the school based on data. Serve in an advisory capacity to the principal/director and support the development and implementation of the School Improvement Plan. Reflect, assess, and plan schools data usage and effectiveness with a focus on student leadership and achievement.

education.university: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
University of North Carolina at Charlotte

skills.name: Teaching
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience teaching 6th-8th grade Language Arts, leading professional learning communities, and mentoring students, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Has experience leading professional learning communities, advising students, and facilitating school improvement plans, showing strong proficiency in leadership.

skills.name: Communication
skills.explanation: Has experience communicating with parents, staff, and students, and facilitating communication within professional learning communities, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Mentoring
skills.explanation: Has experience advising students, particularly young ladies, on various life skills and issues, showing strong proficiency in mentoring.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.explanation: Has experience coordinating school improvement plans and facilitating involvement from parents and the community, indicating solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Data Analysis
skills.explanation: Has experience using data to drive instructional change and assess school effectiveness, showing solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Public Speaking
skills.explanation: Has experience facilitating communication within professional learning communities and advising students on public speaking, indicating solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Community Engagement
skills.explanation: Has experience encouraging community involvement and creating opportunities for parent participation, showing solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Curriculum Development
skills.explanation: Has some experience contributing to the design of school improvement plans, but may not have extensive experience in curriculum development.
